properties.headline: Flood Warning issued January 11 at 2:19PM EST by NWS Indianapolis IN
properties.description:
...The National Weather Service in Indianapolis has issued a Flood
Warning for portions of the following waterways in central and
southern Indiana...

Sugar Creek...White River...

.Lowland flooding is expected to develop along the Sugar Creek near Edinburgh and the White River near Muncie. Significant flooding is not expected. Flooding will affect some local and state roads...low agricultural land and some river
parks. Flooding will begin later tonight and continue through Monday morning.

Recent rainfall of 2.5 to 3.5 inches over the last 48 hours has caused river levels to rise near minor flood stages. River levels will continue to rise over the next 24 hours as water drains into the rivers.

The National Weather Service in Indianapolis has issued a

* Flood Warning for
the Sugar Creek near Edinburgh.
* until further notice.
* At  2:00 PM Saturday the stage was 10.7 feet.
* Flood stage is 10.0 feet.
* At 10.5 feet...Lowland flooding along Sugar Creek during March 2011.
properties.instruction:
Precautionary/Preparedness Actions...

Motorists should never drive into flood water. Turn around and go
another way. Keep children away from flooded areas. Recreational and
agricultural interests should remain alert to changing river
conditions.

For detailed flood information go to weather.gov/ind on the web and
click on rivers and lakes.
